oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Steve Dorff - 2017-12-09
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by singer songwriter Steve Dorff from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on December 2, 2017. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Steve Dorff;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments and songwriter introduction by Abi Tapia / (03:20) Opening comments from Steve and talk about his book I Wrote That One, Too: . . .A Life in Songwriting from Willie to Whitney / (05:44) Introduces the first song / (07:27) Performs I Just Fall In Love Again / (10:51) Talks about his vocal ability and performing in public / (11:39) Intros the next song / (14:30) Performs I Cross My Heart / (17:34) Intros the next song / (18:50) Performs Every Which Way But Loose / (20:04) Intros the next song and tells story about getting a phone call from Clint Eastwood / (20:48) Performs feature film medley of songs including Barroom Buddies, Coca-Cola Cowboy, Cowboys and Clowns, The Man In Love With You, Lasso The Moon, Any Which Way You Can / (26:02) Tells story about getting phone call from a movie director wanting him to write a song about pie for a John Travolta movie / (27:39) Performs the song Me Oh My, I Love Pie /

(28:24) Talks about the motivation and inspiration for writing the next song for a television series / (31:04) Performs As Long As We Got Each Other / (32:11) Talks about the last song / (32:31) Talks about the next song and tells Jermaine Jackson story / (35:24) Performs Take Good Care Of My Heart / (38:39) Talks about the next song / (40:51) Performs Through The Years / (44:30) Answers question about who cuts his hair / (45:29) Answers question about the influence of Broadway musical shows on his songwriting and his favorite songwriters / (46:34) Answers question about if artists ask for input on their recording of his songs and if he's pleased with their recording of his songs / (47:43) Answers question about how songwriters are paid / (49:05) Answers question about being or not being a genre writer / (49:51) Answers question and plays brief excerpt of the song Baby Let's Lay Down And Dance / (50:46) Closing comments / (51:02) Walk-out music / (53:31) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dorff, Steve; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
